intro: Bunchosia monticola, commonly known as the mountain bunchosia, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems that often form dense thickets. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bunchosia monticola is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
